column4: hey guys trying to dual screen... ubuntu sees my two screens in the screen resolution manager in System>Preferences, but nothing is happening, what should I do?
man xrandr
xrandr is a command line utility for dealin with dual monitors.  AFAIK GUI tools in gnome aren't complete yet
http://intellinuxgraphics.org/dualhead.html

xrandr is quite easy, you need to make one edit to xorg.conf to set a large enough Virtual desktop, your card must support a size big enough for both monitors tiled, or you will only be able to clone the screens
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=221174
